poem:
### Revision

Black-box hearts,  
an inkblot on estrogen maps,  
unwritten warnings hushed by unseen hands.  
Data eclipsed by decision's whim,  
as pulses quicken,  
consider the burden of silence—  
bare skinned against the clavicle of uncertainty,  
troubling truths,  
when science is a shifting specter,  
caged in the doctor's quiet sigh.
